section.name: TOPICS IN SOCIOLOGY: Mistakes, Accidents, and Disasters

comments:
*Sociology 041 is a freshman seminar that examines the homelessness problem from a variety of scientific and policy perspectives. Part of the course is focused on examining the definitional and measurement issues, and how they affect our understanding of the scale and composition of the problem. Another part of the course focuses on examining the merits of some of those explanations, and in particular, the role of the affordable housing crisis. 

Seven out of eight students found the readings to be unfit for the class. One student claimed that the readings were “discussed very little in class.” Many students also believed “lectures in class were on tangential topics.” 

Close to half of the students found Professor Bosk’s lectures were “difficult to sit through.” A few students believed Professor Bosk gave “little room for student participation”

The grades in this class are based on participation (35%) and a paper (65%). The course is open to freshmen and upperclassmen.

*This review is based on 8 student comments
